text: Noah Gregor (born July 28, 1998) is a Canadian professional ice hockey centre. He currently plays for the Ottawa Senators of the National Hockey League (NHL). He has also played for the San Jose Sharks and Toronto Maple Leafs ==Career== Before playing in the NHL, Gregor played parts of 4 seasons with the Moose Jaw Warriors, 1 season with the Victoria Royals and 1 season with the Prince Albert Raiders of the Western Hockey League (WHL). During his time with the Warriors, Gregor was named Most Sportsmanlike Player and won both the Rookie of the Year Award and Eastern Conference Rookie of the Year Award. Gregor won the Ed Chynoweth Cup with the Raiders in 2019. He was drafted 111th overall overall by the San Jose Sharks in the 2016 NHL Entry Draft. On April 6, 2018, Gregor signed a three-year, entry-level contract with the Sharks. On October 19, 2019, Gregor made his NHL debut in a 4-3 loss against the Buffalo Sabres. On November 29, he scored his first NHL goal in a 4-1 win against the Los Angeles Kings. On September 13, 2021, Gregor signed a one-year, $750,000 contract to stay with the Sharks. Gregor signed another one-year, $950,000 extension to stay with the Sharks on August 22, 2022. On October 10, 2023, Gregor signed a one-year, $775,000 contract to join the Toronto Maple Leafs. On July 1, 2024, Gregor signed a one-year, $850,000 contract to join the Ottawa Senators. ==References== == Other websites == * Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Ice hockey people from Alberta Category:Moose Jaw Warriors players Category:Ottawa Senators players Category:San Jose Barracuda players Category:San Jose Sharks players Category:Toronto Maple Leafs players
title: Noah Gregor
